description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition nos.2 and 14 (approved plans and refuse storage) pursuant to planning permission reference 161362FUL dated 11/11/2016 for Construction of two apartment blocks of part three, part four storey height containing 22 flats (5x1 bedroom, 13x2 bedroom, 4x3 bedroom) and a row of 5 terraced houses of three storey height (5x4 bedroom), associated refuse and bicycle storage, site landscaping including an internal access street and 20 parking spaces, new and replacement boundary treatments.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of 11/11/2016, when permission was granted.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with documents and drawing title number(s): L01, PP01 (Rev. A), PP02 (Rev. D), PP04 (Rev. B), PP05 (Rev. C), PP06 (Rev. C), PP07 (Rev. C), PP08 (Rev. C), PP10 (Rev. A), PP11 (Rev. A), PP12 (Rev. A), PP13 (Rev. A), PP14 (Rev. A), PP15 (Rev. A), PP16 (Rev. A), PP17 (Rev. A), PP18 (Rev. A), PP19 (Rev. A), PP20 (Rev. A), PP21 (Rev. A), PP22 (Rev. A), 15457/A1/TCP/01, TSP/LBE/P2984/062 (Rev. C), SD15758-02, un-numbered drawing for 'Landscape Design', un-numbered drawing for 'Play Area Elevation', Daylight Sunlight Assessment dated 15 March 2016, Noise Assessment dated 09 March 2016, Transport Statement dated March 2016, Air Quality Assessment dated 15 March 2016, Drainage Strategy Report dated March 2016 and Ground Investigation ref P15-09gi dated January 2016
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| All sustainability measures as approved under discharge of condition application 172471CND dated 20/07/2017 shall be implemented and maintained on site in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies G5, SI2, SI3, SI4, SI8 and SI9 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of each dwelling, each residential unit shall incorporate an Ultra low-NOx gas boilers for space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development, and to reduce the impact of the development on air quality, in accordance with policies SI2, SI3 and SI4,of the London Plan 2021, policy LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012), and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014). | The details of the dynamic thermal modelling and any additional measures to prevent over heating as approved under discharge of conditions application ref 172473CND dated19/07/2017 shall be be implemeted and mainted in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure that the risk of overheating has been sufficiently addressed in accordance with policy SI4 of the London Plan (2021). | The details of the sustainability measures as approved under partial discharge of conditions application shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details set out in 172475CND dated 19/08/2017.

A further details application to fully discharge condition 7 will need to be made to the Local Planning Authority in relation to within three months of the first occupation of new dwellings, Energy Performance Certificates, Display Energy Certificates and Accompany Advisory Reports and detailed SAP modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER for each unit from the "as built stage" following completion of each phase of the development to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures.

To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies SI1, SI2, SI3, and SI4 of the London Plan 2021 (with

FALP 2011/REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies SI1, SI2, SI3, SI4 of the London Plan 2021, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013). | The applicant shall ensure that the internal sound insulation ensures that the acoustic standard not exceeding NR25Leq 5mins (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq, 5mins (octaves), Or NR 25 Leq, 5 mins(one third octaves) inside a living room when noise is generated from the residential use. The development shall be implemented in accordance with this requirement and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Before the development permitted is occupied, storage for a total of thirty six cycle parking spaces for the residential units within Block A and Block B shall be provided. Two additional cycle parking spaces shall be provided per each residential terrace house. The development shall therefore provide a total of forty six cycle parking spaces that comply with adopted standards and shall be made fully available and retained thereafter solely for the purpose of the parking of cycles.

Reason: To promote the use of cycles thereby reducing the congestion of adjacent roads in accordance to London Plan Policy T6.1 (2021). | The details of the Arboricultural Method Statement as approved under discharge of conditions application 170965CND dated 03/05/2017 shall be implemented in accordance with those measures throughout the time the development is being carried out.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in pursuance to the objectives of section 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies D1, G5 and G7 of the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'. | The Programe of Monitoring Measures for Tree Protection shall continue in accordance with the details approved under discharge of conditions application 171095CND dated 03/05/2021.

Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of visual amenity for the area in accordance to the objectives of section 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies D1, G5 and G7 of the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'. | The Tree Planting proposals shall be implemented in accordance with discharge of conditions application 190021CND dated 04/10/2019. Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the works are carried out as approved in the interests of the visual amenity of the area, in accordance to the objections of policies D1, D4 and G7 of the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'. | The refuse and recycling storage and collection facilities shown in drawings PP02 (revision D), PP04 (revision B), PP06 (revision C), and PP07 (revision C) shall provide sufficient capacity for the residents of the approved units and shall be retained permanently. The refuse and recycling storage shall be able to be reasonably and practically collected by the Council.
Reason: In the interests of the adequate refuse and recycling storage and collection cycle for future occupiers and in accordance with policy SI8 of the London Plan 2021.

| The approved details of access arrangement to maintain vehicular and pedestrian access by the owners and occupiers of properties at Nos. 5, 7, 9, 11 Dabbs Hill Lane and Nos. 5 and 7 Doncaster Drive, as approved under discharge of conditions application 190451CND dated 27/02/2019, shall be implemented and maintained as such in perpetuity.

Reason; In order to ensure that suitable and safe pedestrian access is provided to adjoining occupiers in conjunction with the development and for those passing though in pursuance to the objectives of policies T6, T6.1, GG1,D4, and D8 of the London Plan (2021) and ELV to policy 6.13 and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the five terrace houses that form part of the approved development shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan 2021. | The measures set out in the site construction method statement and management plan as approved under  discharge of conditions application 171096CND dated 03/05/2017 shall be carried out in accordance with those documents.

Reason: To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies T3,T6, D11, D12 and D14  of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
